<blockquote>
     ==Brief Description==

     <img src="http://img585.imageshack.us/img585/4808/optional.jpg"  width="26" height="24"/>

     <b>Quick Reference:</b> 

     Brief description, presented in a simple technical language, to distinguish the species from other close or similar ones.

     <b>Class:</b> http://code.google.com/p/pliniancore/wiki/TextDescriptionClass
</blockquote>

<blockquote>
     ==Identification Keys==
     <img src="http://img585.imageshack.us/img585/4808/optional.jpg"  width="26" height="24"/> <img src="http://img214.imageshack.us/img214/4559/multipleu.jpg" width="26" height="24"/> <img src="http://img6.imageshack.us/img6/1315/sequencej.jpg" width="26" height="24"/> 
     <b>Quick Reference:</b>

     Tool for the identification of organisms, comprising a series of steps, each of which represents a question about one or more characters of the organism. Each step offers multiple alternatives, choosing one of them will lead us to the next step until ending, finally, in the name of the organism. Most printed keys have only two alternatives, so called dichotomous keys.

     <b>Class:</b>
</blockquote>
<blockquote><blockquote>
          ===Keys===

          <img src="http://img585.imageshack.us/img585/4808/optional.jpg"  width="26" height="24"/> <img src="http://img19.imageshack.us/img19/4356/infinitol.jpg"  width="26" height="24"/>

          <b>Quick Reference:</b> 

          Dichotomic or multientrance keys.

          <b>Class:</b> http://code.google.com/p/pliniancore/wiki/TextDescriptionClass
</blockquote></blockquote>
<blockquote><blockquote>
          ===Reference===

          <img src="http://img585.imageshack.us/img585/4808/optional.jpg"  width="26" height="24"/> <img src="http://img19.imageshack.us/img19/4356/infinitol.jpg"  width="26" height="24"/>

          <b>Quick Reference:</b> http://www.tdwg.org/uploads/media/v101.xsd 

          In any of the above fields, if any data was obtained from the literature, a reference must be made, just as it is done in a regular scientific publication, for example (Martinez y Barrera, 1997). The referenced literature is placed in this field, also in a format similar to the one in a scientific publication.

          <b>Class:</b> tcs: referenceType
</blockquote></blockquote>
